name: CBT
description: Techniques to identify and reframe negative thought patterns.

cards.title: Identifying Automatic Thoughts
cards.description: Learn to spot thoughts that pop up automatically in response to situations
cards.instructions: Write down a situation and the immediate thoughts that came to mind

cards.title: Emotional Intensity Scale
cards.description: Rate the intensity of emotions associated with thoughts
cards.instructions: Rate each emotion from 0-100 and track changes after reframing

cards.title: Evidence For and Against
cards.description: Examine evidence supporting and challenging your thoughts
cards.instructions: List factual evidence that supports and contradicts your thought

cards.title: Common Thinking Traps
cards.description: Identify cognitive distortions in your thinking
cards.instructions: Review the thought and identify any thinking traps like all-or-nothing thinking

cards.title: Alternative Perspectives
cards.description: Generate different ways of viewing the situation
cards.instructions: Write at least 3 alternative ways to interpret the same situation

cards.title: Behavioral Experiment
cards.description: Test your thoughts through real-world experiments
cards.instructions: Design and conduct a small experiment to test your prediction

cards.title: Thought Chain Analysis
cards.description: Track how one thought leads to another
cards.instructions: Map out the sequence of thoughts that follow your initial thought

cards.title: Core Belief Investigation
cards.description: Identify and examine underlying core beliefs
cards.instructions: Trace your automatic thoughts back to core beliefs about yourself/world

cards.title: Reframing Practice
cards.description: Transform negative thoughts into balanced alternatives
cards.instructions: Take a negative thought and create a more balanced, realistic version

cards.title: Future Projection
cards.description: Examine thoughts about future events
cards.instructions: Write predictions and examine evidence for/against them

cards.title: Emotion-Thought Connection
cards.description: Link specific emotions to specific thoughts
cards.instructions: List emotions and identify the thoughts that trigger each one

cards.title: Worst-Case Scenario
cards.description: Examine and cope with worst-case fears
cards.instructions: Write worst fear and develop coping strategies for that scenario

cards.title: Cost-Benefit Analysis
cards.description: Analyze pros and cons of holding onto a thought
cards.instructions: List benefits and drawbacks of maintaining this belief

cards.title: Historical Evidence
cards.description: Review past experiences that challenge negative thoughts
cards.instructions: Find past examples that contradict your current negative thought

cards.title: Compassionate Response
cards.description: Practice self-compassion in response to negative thoughts
cards.instructions: Write response to your thought as if speaking to a good friend

cards.title: Activity Monitoring
cards.description: Track daily activities and associated mood levels
cards.instructions: Log activities and rate mood (0-10) for each hour of the day

cards.title: Values Assessment
cards.description: Identify key life values to guide activity selection
cards.instructions: List important life areas and values that matter to you

cards.title: Pleasant Activity Scheduling
cards.description: Plan enjoyable activities for the week
cards.instructions: Schedule three enjoyable activities for specific times this week

cards.title: Graded Task Assignment
cards.description: Break down complex tasks into manageable steps
cards.instructions: Choose one avoided task and break it into 5 smaller steps

cards.title: Social Connection Planning
cards.description: Plan meaningful social interactions
cards.instructions: Identify and schedule two social activities for the week

cards.title: Success Log
cards.description: Document completed activities and their impact
cards.instructions: Record completed activities and resulting mood changes

cards.title: Activity Hierarchy
cards.description: Create difficulty hierarchy of avoided activities
cards.instructions: List 10 activities from easiest to most challenging

cards.title: Routine Building
cards.description: Establish healthy daily routines
cards.instructions: Design morning or evening routine with 5 key activities

cards.title: Energy Management
cards.description: Match activities to energy levels throughout day
cards.instructions: Map energy levels and plan activities accordingly

cards.title: Reward Planning
cards.description: Set up rewards for completing challenging tasks
cards.instructions: Choose appropriate rewards for different activity levels

cards.title: Activity Experimentation
cards.description: Try new activities outside comfort zone
cards.instructions: Select and try one new activity, record experience

cards.title: Balance Assessment
cards.description: Evaluate life area activity balance
cards.instructions: Rate activity levels across different life domains

cards.title: Motivation Building
cards.description: Develop strategies to overcome inertia
cards.instructions: List barriers and solutions for starting activities

cards.title: Progress Tracking
cards.description: Monitor activity implementation progress
cards.instructions: Review and rate progress on planned activities

cards.title: Environmental Activation
cards.description: Modify environment to support activity engagement
cards.instructions: Identify and implement three environmental changes
